variable.name: AAO_DX1
variable.description: Age of onset for alcohol diagnosis 1 (ALDX1; no info = 0) - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: AAO_DX2
variable.description: Age of onset for alcohol diagnosis 2 (ALDX2; no info = 0) - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: AAO_DX3
variable.description: Age of onset for alcohol diagnosis 3 (ALDX3; no info = 0) - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: age
variable.description: Age at interview

variable.name: age_test
variable.description: Age at testing

variable.name: ALDX1
variable.description: Alcohol diagnosis - DSM3R + Feighner - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: ALDX2
variable.description: Alcohol diagnosis - DSM4 - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: ALDX3
variable.description: Alcohol diagnosis - ICD10 - Note: See also COGA Instruments

variable.name: binge_drinking
variable.description: Ever binge drink (No info = 0)

variable.name: blackouts
variable.description: Three or more black-outs (No Info = 0)

variable.name: craving
variable.description: (Alcohol) Craving (No Info = 0)

variable.name: desire_quit
variable.description: Persistent desire to quit (drinking; no info = 0)

variable.name: ecb21
variable.description: Eyes-closed-resting (ECR) EEG results - first component of SVD - Beta 2 band (16.5 to 20 Hz). Note: Data were extracted from the Eyes Closed Resting EEG experiment. The ecb21 variable corresponds to the first component of a trilinear SVD (Singular Value Decompositions) of Beta2 band (16.5 to 20 Hz) bipolar electrode data.

variable.name: education
variable.description: Level of education

variable.name: ethnicity
variable.description: Self-reported ethnicity

variable.name: fam_history
variable.description: Family's alcohol history

variable.name: Income
variable.description: Annual income

variable.name: less_time
variable.description: Spent so much time drinking, had little time for anything else (No info = 0)
variable.value: Yes - lasted one month or longer

variable.name: marital_status
variable.description: Marital status

variable.name: max_drinks
variable.description: Maximum number of drinks in a 24 hour period (no info = -9)

variable.name: morning_drink
variable.description: Morning drinking (No Info = 0)

variable.name: narrowing
variable.description: Narrowing of drinking repertoire (No Info = 0)

variable.name: other_problems
variable.description: Emotional/psychological problems resulting from drinking (No info = 0)

variable.name: p3amp_PZ
variable.description: Visual oddball experiment (VO) - parietal midline channel P3 amplitude - baseline - 100 ms vs. largest peak 300 - 600 ms after stimulus. Note: Data were extracted from the target case of the Visual Oddball experiment at the parietal midline channel (PZ). The P3 amplitude was measured as the voltage (μV) difference between the pre-stimulus baseline (100 ms pre-stimulus) and the largest positively deflected peak in the latency window, 300-600 ms after stimulus onset.

variable.name: Physical_problems
variable.description: Physical health problems resulting from drinking (No Info = 0)

variable.name: sex
variable.description: Participant's gender

variable.name: stop_drinking
variable.description: Gave up activities in order to drink (No Info = 0)

variable.name: subject_id
variable.description: Unique random subject ID

variable.name: ttdt_PZ
variable.description: Visual oddball experiment (VO) - parietal midline channel late time results; delta band power (1 to 3 Hz frequency; μV² [power]). Note: Data were extracted from the target case of the Visual Oddball experiment at the parietal midline channel (PZ). The extracted measures correspond to the 'late' time window, which is set at 300 ms to 700 ms following stimulus presentation (bounding the visual P3 event) and the delta band power (1 to 3 Hz).

variable.name: ttth_FZ
variable.description: Visual oddball experiment (VO) - frontal midline channel late time results; theta band power (4 to 7 Hz frequency; μV² [power]). Note: Data were extracted from the target case of the Visual Oddball experiment at the frontal midline channel (FZ). The extracted measures correspond to the 'late' time window, which is set at 300 ms to 700 ms following stimulus presentation (bounding the visual P3 event) and the theta band power (3 to 7 Hz).

variable.name: type
variable.description: Case or control status

variable.name: withdrawal_SXs
variable.description: Withdrawal symptoms (2 or more together; no info = 0)
